CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. 2, reads: "Neighbors Play Santa - The Neighborhood Friendly Club of the 2200 block Bedford Ave., in true spirit of donating something for others at Christmas time, prepared 25 large baskets of food for needy families at the home of Mrs. Cora Holmes and began distributing them, Tuesday. Kneeling, Mrs. Holmes, who is secretary of the group.  Front row, rear, left to right: Mrs. Mary Jane Prichett, vice president; Mrs. Adrent Allen, president; Constable Thomas J. (Tommy) Smith, who assisted with the donation; Mrs. Virginia Griffin, and Mrs. Ida Rivers.  Back row, same order; Mrs. Lena Murriell, chaplain; Cora Carter and James Watt. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Cora Holmes kneeling in center, and standing left to right: Mary Jane Prichett, Lena Murriell, Adrent Allen, Cora Carter, Constable Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith, James Watt, Virginia Griffin, and Ida Rivers, posed with brick patterned boxes of food, including celery and Drake bread, in Holmes home for food drive sponsored by the Neighborhood Friendly Club of 2200 block, Bedford Avenue, Hill District
